content.description: Sit start with a left hand pocket/sidepull and a right hand on a bump on the shelf. From there, climb straight up the tiered shelf, reach the bumps on top, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will do, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Chantelle.

content.description:
A one-two punch of a problem, Own The Space climbs a short overhang on perfect stone over a decent landing.

Stand start with hands matched on the large edge about six feet off the ground. From there, paste a foot and throw a right heel onto the mini-shelf, crank up to a right hand crimp, mantle with the left, make a desperate move with the right hand to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: Two pads minimum would be prudent. The landing is a mixture of smooth soil and juniper roots, but with a few pads, the landing cleans up very nicely.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Chantelle.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand incut edge and a right hand on the blunt gaston micro edge (the sit start is awkward and the crux). From there, pull up and snatch the undercling sidepull feature, set the feet, stick the lip, and top it out using the bumps.
content.protection: A pad will do, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center east face of Chantelle.
